tool_description: The WebKnox question-answering API allows you to find answers to natural language questions. These questions can be factual such as "What is the capital of Australia" or more complex.
name: Question-Answering
title: Question-Answering

api_list.name: Answer a Question
api_list.description: Find an answer to a given question.

optional_parameters.name: answerLookup
optional_parameters.description: Whether the answer can be looked up in a given set of answers.

optional_parameters.name: answerSearch
optional_parameters.description: Whether the answer can be searched on the Web. If set to true, the answer might take up to a minute to show up.

api_list.name: Quickly Answer a Question
api_list.description: Get a short, quick answer to a simple question.

required_parameters.name: question
required_parameters.description: A question or keywords that can be answered with simple facts.

api_list.name: Suggest conversation topics
api_list.description: Query this endpoint to get suggests about what WebKnox can converse about.

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: The (partial) query of the user to get suggests for.

optional_parameters.name: number
optional_parameters.description: The number of suggests, must be between 1 and 25.

api_list.name: Have a conversation.
api_list.description: Using all question answering functionality to have a contextual conversation with WebKnox.

optional_parameters.name: contextId
optional_parameters.description: Every conversation has a context, pass a globally unique identifier for your conversation.
